title: Chicken Souvlaki with Tzatziki Sauce Recipe
description: Chicken souvlaki skewers are marinated Greek kabobs that are cooked on the grill for a simply delicious appetizer with homemade tzatziki sauce.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes BBQ & Grilling Chicken Skewers and Kabobs Chicken Souvlaki with Tzatziki Sauce 4.7 (503) 348 Reviews 48 Photos Chicken souvlaki skewers are marinated Greek kabobs. Fantastic flavor for chicken. The marinade can also be used for pork. Submitted by Tanya Petkos Schroeder Updated on March 14, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 48 48 48 48 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Additional Time: 2 hrs Total Time: 2 hrs 30 mins Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings Kabobs: ¼ cup olive oil 2 cloves garlic, minced 2 tablespoons lemon juice 1 teaspoon dried oregano ½ teaspoon salt 1 ½ pounds skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cut into bite-sized pieces 6 wooden skewers, or as needed Sauce: 1 (6 ounce) container plain Greek-style yogurt ½ cucumber - peeled, seeded, and grated 1 tablespoon olive oil 2 teaspoons white vinegar 1 clove garlic, minced 1 pinch salt Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Prepare kabobs: Combine olive oil, garlic, lemon juice, oregano, and salt in a large resealable bag. Add chicken, coat with the marinade, squeeze out excess air and seal the bag; marinate in the refrigerator for 2 hours. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Prepare sauce: Mix yogurt, cucumber, olive oil, vinegar, garlic, and salt together in a bowl. Refrigerate sauce for flavors to blend, 1 to 2 hours. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Soak wooden skewers in a bowl of cold water for about 15 minutes. Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Remove chicken from marinade and thread onto the soaked skewers. Discard unused marinade. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cook the skewers on the preheated grill, turning frequently until browned on all sides and chicken is no longer pink in the center, about 7 to 8 minutes per side. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Serve with tzatziki sauce. Enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Editor's Note: The nutrition data for this recipe includes the full amount of the marinade ingredients. The actual amount of the marinade consumed will vary. I Made It Print 928 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 268 Calories 17g Fat 3g Carbs 26g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 6 Calories 268 % Daily Value * Total Fat 17g 22% Saturated Fat 4g 19% Cholesterol 71mg 24% Sodium 295mg 13% Total Carbohydrate 3g 1% Dietary Fiber 0g 1% Total Sugars 1g Protein 26g 51% Vitamin C 3mg 4% Calcium 21mg 2% Iron 1mg 6% Potassium 236mg 5% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Chicken Souvlaki with Tzatziki Sauce 01 of 48 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 48 Photo by  Spyce 05/25/2022 Delicious! I followed the recipe with the only differences being I cut the chicken breast into thin strips and threaded them onto skewers, and I cooked them on my Ninja Foodi XL Grill and Griddle and grilled on high for 8 minutes. 03 of 48 Photo by  Mary Sch 07/26/2020 04 of 48 Photo by  Carl Newton 06/21/2020 05 of 48 Photo by  Wendy Kan 05/22/2020 Delicious recipe! Tasty and juicy. 06 of 48 Photo by  Lindsay Grobert 01/22/2020 07 of 48 Photo by  Lisa Marie May-Kadaraitis 01/07/2020 I ended up marinating the chicken over 24 hours and it turned out delicious. 08 of 48 Photo by  Lisa Stedman 10/14/2019 09 of 48 Photo by  Yolanda Humby 07/25/2019 I loved this recipe and so did my husband. The only change I made was to add more salt, pepper and garlic. 10 of 48 Photo by  silverspoon819 07/21/2019 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Chicken Kabobs 59 Ratings Hawaiian Chicken Pineapple Kabobs 798 Ratings Reshmi Kebab (Silken Kebabs) 20 Ratings Chili-Lime Chicken Kabobs 1,008 Ratings Shish Tawook Grilled Chicken 315 Ratings Chicken Satay 574 Ratings Chicken and Bacon Shish Kabobs 1,109 Ratings Yummy Honey Chicken Kabobs 3,040 Ratings Grilled Teriyaki Chicken Thigh Skewers Singapore Satay 19 Ratings Tahini Chicken Skewers 4 Ratings Ginger Grilled Chicken Satay 5 Ratings Ultra Easy Pineapple Chicken Kabobs 74 Ratings Spiedies Marinade 1 Rating Lemon Garlic Chicken Kebabs 3 Ratings Grilled Pesto Chicken Kabobs 8 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
